org.jamesframework.core.problems

Class SubsetProblemWithData<DataType extends SubsetData>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.problems.ProblemWithData<SubsetSolution,DataType>
      • org.jamesframework.core.problems.SubsetProblemWithData<DataType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - underlying data type, should implement the interface SubsetData
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Problem<SubsetSolution>, SubsetProblem

    public class SubsetProblemWithData<DataType extends SubsetData>
extends ProblemWithData<SubsetSolution,DataType>
implements SubsetProblem
    Represents a subset problem with data of a given data type, implementing the interface SubsetData, and with solution type SubsetSolution. The minimum and maximum allowed subset size are specified in the subset problem, and subset solutions with a size outside these bounds are rejected. The problem also provides methods for creating random subset solutions and copying subset solutions (see Problem interface), as well as an additional method for creating empty subset solutions in which no entities are selected.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubsetProblemWithData

        public SubsetProblemWithData(Objective<? super SubsetSolution,? super DataType> objective,
                             DataType data,
                             int minSubsetSize,
                             int maxSubsetSize,
                             boolean sortedIDs)
        Creates a new subset problem with given objective, data and minimum/maximum subset size. Both objective and data are not allowed to be null, an exception will be thrown if they are. Any objective designed to evaluate subset solutions (or more general solutions) using the specified data type (or more general data) is accepted. The minimum and maximum subset size should be contained in [0,n] where n is the number of entities in the given subset data from which a subset is to be selected. Also, the minimum size should be smaller than or equal to the maximum size. If sortedIDs is true, any subset solution generated by this problem (random, copy, ...) will store the underlying IDs in sorted sets.
        Parameters:
        objective - objective function, can not be null
        data - underlying subset data, can not be null
        minSubsetSize - minimum subset size (should be ≥ 0 and ≤ maximum subset size)
        maxSubsetSize - maximum subset size (should be ≥ minimum subset size and ≤ number of entities in underlying data)
        sortedIDs - indicates whether IDs are sorted in generated subset solutions
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if objective or data is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid minimum or maximum subset size is specified

      • SubsetProblemWithData

        public SubsetProblemWithData(Objective<? super SubsetSolution,? super DataType> objective,
                             DataType data,
                             int minSubsetSize,
                             int maxSubsetSize)
        Creates a new subset problem with given objective, data and minimum/maximum subset size. Both objective and data are not allowed to be null, an exception will be thrown if they are. Any objective designed to evaluate subset solutions (or more general solutions) using the specified data type (or more general data) is accepted. The minimum and maximum subset size should be contained in [0,n] where n is the number of entities in the given subset data from which a subset is to be selected. Also, the minimum size should be smaller than or equal to the maximum size. Generated subset solutions do not guarantee any order of IDs.
        Parameters:
        objective - objective function, can not be null
        data - underlying subset data, can not be null
        minSubsetSize - minimum subset size (should be ≥ 0 and ≤ maximum subset size)
        maxSubsetSize - maximum subset size (should be ≥ minimum subset size and ≤ number of entities in underlying data)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if objective or data is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid minimum or maximum subset size is specified

      • SubsetProblemWithData

        public SubsetProblemWithData(Objective<? super SubsetSolution,? super DataType> objective,
                             DataType data,
                             int fixedSubsetSize)
        Creates a subset problem with fixed subset size. Equivalent to calling
         SubsetProblem p = new SubsetProblem(objective, data, fixedSubsetSize, fixedSubsetSize);
        The fixed subset size should be contained in [0,n] where n is the number of entities in the given subset data from which a subset is to be selected. Generated subset solutions do not guarantee any order of IDs.
        Parameters:
        objective - objective function, can not be null
        data - underlying subset data, can not be null
        fixedSubsetSize - fixed subset size
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if objective or data is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid fixed subset size is specified

      • createRandomSolution

        public SubsetSolution createRandomSolution()
        Create a random solution within the allowed minimum and maximum subset size. The IDs of all entities are taken from the underlying subset data, and a random subset of IDs is selected.
        Specified by:
        createRandomSolution in interface Problem<SubsetSolution>
        Returns:
        random subset solution within minimum and maximum size

        Returns:

      • rejectSolution

        public boolean rejectSolution(SubsetSolution solution)
        Checks whether the given subset solution is rejected. A subset solution is rejected if any of the rejecting constraints is violated (see ProblemWithData.addRejectingConstraint(Constraint)) or if it has an invalid size (number of selected IDs).
        Specified by:
        rejectSolution in interface Problem<SubsetSolution>
        Overrides:
        rejectSolution in class ProblemWithData<SubsetSolution,DataType extends SubsetData>
        Parameters:
        solution - subset solution to verify
        Returns:
        true if the solution is rejected

      • rejectSolution

        public boolean rejectSolution(SubsetSolution solution,
                              boolean checkSubsetSize)
        Checks whether the given subset solution is rejected. A subset solution is rejected if any of the rejecting constraints is violated (see ProblemWithData.addRejectingConstraint(Constraint)). Also, if checkSubsetSize is true, the solution is rejected if it has an invalid size.
        Specified by:
        rejectSolution in interface SubsetProblem
        Parameters:
        solution - subset solution to verify
        checkSubsetSize - indicates whether a solution should be rejected if it has an invalid size
        Returns:
        true if the solution is rejected

        public void setMinSubsetSize(int minSubsetSize)

        Throws:

        Throws:
